title: Orchid & Houseplants Pest Control Made Easy  DIY Garlic-Infused Alcohol Solution #ninjaorchids

tasks.task: Prepare and apply a garlic-based pesticide to orchids to combat moth larvae and other pests.
subtasks: Chopping garlic cloves into small pieces.
Measure 70% isopropyl alcohol.
Dilute the alcohol with water to 100 milliliters.
Add chopped garlic pieces to the alcohol mixture and let it brew in the refrigerator for 24 hours.
Strain the garlic pieces from the solution.
Spray the prepared pesticide on the orchids, focusing on affected areas.

tasks.task: Prepare and apply a garlic-based fungicide to orchids.
subtasks: Measure 16 ounces of RO water.
Crush a quarter cup of ground garlic.
Mix the ground garlic with RO water and let it steep for 24 hours.
Strain the garlic from the solution.
Apply the fungicide to any affected areas of the orchids.

Prepare and apply a garlic-based pesticide (insecticide) to orchids to combat moth larvae and other pests.
subtasks: Chop 5 cloves of garlic into small pieces.
Measure 70% isopropyl alcohol and 30% water.
Mix the alcohol and water in a pump spray container.
Add chopped garlic to the mixture and refrigerate overnight.
Spray the solution onto the orchids, focusing on affected areas.

tasks.task: Prepare and apply a garlic-based fungicide to orchids.
subtasks: Measure 16 ounces of reverse osmosis (RO) water.
Crush approximately 1/8 cup of garlic (5 large cloves).
Mix the crushed garlic with RO water in a spray bottle.
Apply the solution to any affected areas of the orchids.
